statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Montana 80, Weber State 72
article.story: MISSOULA, Mont. (AP) -- Kamarr Davis scored 23 points Thursday, 12 of them during a second-half run, as Montana opened a 19-point lead in defeating Weber State 80-72. Montana (11-10, 5-3 Big Sky) moved above the .500 mark for the first time since December 2003. The Wildcats (8-13, 3-6 Big Sky) led only twice, each time by two points in the first half. Davis hit 10-of-13 shots, including both his 3-point attempts, and scored 15 of his points in the second half. The Grizzlies led 49-42 when Davis scored the first seven points in a 9-0 run that made it 58-42 with 9:32 left. He had two more baskets and the second 3-pointer with 6:32 left. Andrew Strait's bucket with 5:48 to play capped an 18-6 run that made it 67-48. Weber got no closer than eight points. Matt Dlouhy had 14 of his 16 points in the first half when the Grizzlies opened a 35-32 lead. Strait finished with 14 points and Matt Martin had 10 points and seven assists. The Grizzlies shot 53 percent from the field and made 9-of-16 3-pointers, including 4-of-6 by Dlouhy. Coric Riggs led Weber with 18 points, hitting all four of his 3-pointers and 7-of-8 overall. Lance Allred added 14 points, Troy Goodell had 12 and Brett Cox had 11. Davis was academically ineligle earlier in the season when Weber beat the Grizzlies 76-62.
